intro: Cacalia paucicapitata, commonly known as the few-headed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, narrow leaves. It produces a single or few flower heads per stem, which bloom in the summer months. Cacalia paucicapitata is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade.
